org.ops4j.peaberry
Class Peaberry

java.lang.Object
  org.ops4j.peaberry.Peaberry

public final class Peaberry
extends java.lang.Object

Guice extension that supports injection of dynamic services.

Method Summary
static Module getBundleModule(BundleContext bundleContext)
          Creates a Guice module for the current OSGi bundle with useful bindings, such as the BundleContext and registers a BindingFactory that binds unbound injection points annotated with Service to matching OSGi services.

          Create a new OSGi ServiceRegistry adaptor for the given bundle.

serviceProvider

public static <T> Provider<T> serviceProvider(ServiceRegistry registry,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> target)
Creates a dynamic service provider for the given ServiceRegistry. The provider is configured to find all services compatible with the target.

Parameters:
registry - dynamic service registry
target - current binding target
Returns:
dynamic service provider

Creates a dynamic service provider for the given ServiceRegistry. The provider is configured with the Service specification and is optionally Leased.

getOSGiServiceRegistry

public static ServiceRegistry getOSGiServiceRegistry(BundleContext bundleContext)
Create a new OSGi ServiceRegistry adaptor for the given bundle.

Parameters:
bundleContext - current bundle context
Returns:
OSGi specific ServiceRegistry

nonDelegatingContainer

public static void nonDelegatingContainer()
Enable support for using Guice in non-delegating containers, such as OSGi, both in the current thread and any threads created by it after this point.

getBundleModule

public static Module getBundleModule(BundleContext bundleContext)
Creates a Guice module for the current OSGi bundle with useful bindings, such as the BundleContext and registers a BindingFactory that binds unbound injection points annotated with Service to matching OSGi services. An OSGi classloader hook is also set for the thread creating this module.

Parameters:
bundleContext - current bundle context
Returns:
OSGi service injection rules
